timeline.message:
NF: Factorize whiteboard undos

Note that !mWhiteboard.undoEmpty() implies
mWhiteboard.isUndoModeActive(), so the code actions is not changed

There are four cases to consider:

* Either there is no white board shown; in which case we go to the
"else" part of the code, as before
* Either there is a whiteboard, but no stroke has ever been made. In
  the previous code, both condition fails. In the new code, the first
  condition fails. In both case, we go to the else part of the code.
* Either there is some actions to undo; in which case in the previous
  code, the first condition is satisfied; in the new code the first
  and the second conditions are satisfied; so in both case we execute:
  ```
            undoIcon = R.drawable.ic_eraser_variant_white_24dp;
            undoEnabled = true;
```
* Either strokes have been made, and all have been undone. In this
case, in the previous code the first condition fail and the second
suceed. In the new code the first condition succeed and the second
fail. In both case, we execute:
```
            undoIcon = R.drawable.ic_eraser_variant_white_24dp;
            undoEnabled = false;
```
